message.content:
{"id": "5473", 
"title": "Bug 5473: ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces", 
"description": "Bug 5473: ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251.", 
"OB": "When executing the ShiftLeft operation on text with intermixed tabs and spaces, the behavior is inconsistent. The text doesn't shift as expected and there is confusion when there is a stray space.", 
"EB": "After replacing the tab character in the first line with spaces so that both lines are indented the same visually, executing the ShiftLeft operation should shift the second line left and the first line should be shifted left at least to the space character (i.e., get rid of the tab). This will eliminate confusion and ensure the text shifts as desired.", 
"SR": "To resolve this issue, modify the ShiftLeft functionality to handle intermixed tabs and spaces properly. When executing ShiftLeft, ensure that the first line is shifted left at least until the space character, removing any tabs. Additionally, the second line should be shifted left as expected. This will provide consistent behavior and eliminate confusion when using ShiftLeft with tabs and spaces."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '5473', 'title': 'Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces', 'description': 'Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': "Replace the tab character in the first line with spaces so that the twolines are indented the same visually.Execute ShiftLeft.The text now moves.I'm not sure how this is spec'd, but in the first scenario it seems like thesecond line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left atleast to the space character (i.e., get rid of the tab).At any rate, it'sdefinitely confusing if there is a stray space.You don't know why the textwon't shift. ", 'SR': ''}
